description.content: Wizard Within is a company that develops customized storybooks for children. What makes that interesting for me as a web developer is that I get to program a preview of the book along with the customized names. Since the first developed book has 3 different names with different story combinations according to the first letter of each of the names, I would then need to program the book preview app to show the customized pages along with the different pages/images along with the inputted name.
As the only web developer in the company, I'm responsible to maintain and further develop the website. I mainly use PHP, opencart and WordPress along with phpMyAdmin.

Before joining CRAFT la, I didn't like the idea of Web Development since I'm not strong in designs. With this opportunity to be a part of CRAFT la, I really wanted to dive deep into Web Development to see if it would be something I'd love. Through this internship, I got to mess with React and GraphQL as an introduction to the world of Web Dev and I fell in love with it!

During this internship, I was tasked with developing an Order Management System (OMS) using a single-page application. I developed the front-end using React while styling with PrimeReact, I then used Apollo GraphQL as the back-end. I was also tasked with creating small responsive React Apps that will be used on the company’s WordPress site.

My first internship experience! After finishing my first semester at Western Michigan University, I went back to my home country, Malaysia, during the summer break. Without much to do, I decided to seek an internship to get to know more about my degree. After sending out my resume, I received an opportunity to work at CTI Resources!

During this internship, I was only skilled with Java but had to work using C#. Since C# and Java are kind of similar, I understood it pretty quickly. Since the company does SCADA, I got to mess with Azure Cloud. I was then tasked to develop a C# program to communicate with it. After that, I was given a RaspBerry Pi to develop an ASP.net site that runs within the company’s network. I also assisted in the testing of new products in the company.
